page.title: 09Greenhaugh First School 2
page.content: The school keeps in touch with the community by participating in local events such as Harvest Festival at Thorneyburn and by entertaining friends and neighbours at school events. Various members of the community come into school to share their skills with the children. We rely on the goodwill of parents for help with transport and occasionally we borrow a minibus. We take children on field study trips and to music and drama productions when appropriate. We join in activities with other schools, particularly during the final year. All children have the opportunity of learning to swim at Low Cranecleugh. This year we took older children on a week-long visit to a field study centre at Netherton where they lived and worked with Kielder children. We plan a similar visit to Beal.
